New Records: Virat Kohli scored his first T20I century in 83 international innings, ending a 1,020-day drought
Key Match Events: Kohli mis-hit a pull of Mohammad Nabi, but Ibrahim Zadran misjudged the space behind him, ending up going one-handed and tapping the ball over the boundary

Rahul tried to push the scoring rate up, followed in Kohli's steps with a fifty and just when he was looking dangerous and poised for his typical steep acceleration, he mistimed a pull down the ground for a catch to long-on
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took 5 wickets for 4 runs, including Hazratullah Zazai, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Karim Janat, Najibullah Zadran, and Azmatullah Omarzai
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his happiness and gratitude towards his wife Anushka for her support during his century drought
The article does not mention any significant post-match reflections from other players or coaches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan wore a dazed look playing less than 24 hours after the heartbreak against Pakistan
India made three changes to their team, with Kohli opening the innings in the absence of Rohit Sharma
Bhuvneshwar Kumar's outswinger-inswinger trick was a key factor in his 5-wicket haul
